controller

Class PlayerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PlayerContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PlayerContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class together with other concrete subclasses of 'Player' make up the "controller" of the tic tac toe game.

    This is the context class in a "state pattern" arrangement based on the GOF design patterns book. Its public methods are defined in the 'player' and 'ActionListener' interfaces. the only public method used by the concrete subclasses is the setMove() method. Otherwise the concrete subclasses use only the packageScope methods.

    the behavior of this class is set and controlled by the concrete subclasses of player acting as state objects.

    this class provides public methods as described in the 'Player' Interface.
    Author:
    {}rpheus

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static Board board
      the model that this controller is updating
      private static Player player
      The active player
      private static Player player1
      player 1,the human player
      private static Player player2
      player 2, the AI player
      private CellButton targetButton
      the CellButton associated with this instance of PlayerContext
      private static java.lang.String token
      the token of the current player
      private GameWindow view
      the view that the controller is updating

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerContext(GameWindow window, CellButton targetButton)
      constructor takes a reference to the view to update (GameWindow) and a reference to the button that is creating it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      As one of the concrete subclasseses of player is an action listener this class must be too,hence this overridden method.
      (package private) Board getBoard()
      gets the current state of the board
      (package private) CellButton getButton()
      gets the button associated with this playerContext
      void play(PlayerContext p)
      As this object IS a player it needs a play() method, this method calls the play method in whichever concrete subclass of player is currently the active player.
      void setMove(Move move)
      updates model(board) and the view(GameWindow), then checks for an endgame scenario, if one has been reached it calls the appropriate methods in the view and model.
      (package private) void setToO()
      for use by concrete subclasses of 'player', this method sets the active player to 'x'
      (package private) void setToX()
      For use by concrete subclasses of 'player', this method sets the active player to 'x'
      static void swapPlayers()
      swap the players so that human player is first and cpu second or visa versus.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerContext

        public PlayerContext(GameWindow window,
             CellButton targetButton)
        constructor takes a reference to the view to update (GameWindow) and a reference to the button that is creating it. it initializes these to internal vars, and sets the default player to player1
        Parameters:
        window, - the view to be updated.
        targetButton, - the CellButton that this object is responsible for.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play(PlayerContext p)
        As this object IS a player it needs a play() method, this method calls the play method in whichever concrete subclass of player is currently the active player.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Player
        Parameters:
        p - (self reference passed by other 'state object' concrete subclasses of 'player')

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        As one of the concrete subclasseses of player is an action listener this class must be too,hence this overridden method. It calls this.play() passing itself(this object) to the play method.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • setMove

        public void setMove(Move move)
        updates model(board) and the view(GameWindow), then checks for an endgame scenario, if one has been reached it calls the appropriate methods in the view and model.
        Specified by:
        setMove in interface Player
        Parameters:
        move - (the move to be played)
